University of Münster, Germany, c. 2000-2004,led by Gabriele Müller Oberhauser; transcribed by Ulrike Grassnick. The manuscripts of the Pardoner's Tales were transcribed in partnership with the Canterbury Tales Project, using images and other resources supplied by the Project. No part of these transcripts is contained in this iteration of the Project.

University of Sheffield, 1994-1999, led by Norman Blake: Michael Pidd and Estelle Stubbs, with Linda Cross, Claire Thomson, Orietta Da Rold and Simon Horobin. In partnership with the Canterbury Tales Project, at that time led by Norman Blake in partnership with Peter Robinson and Elizabeth Solopova (up to 1998), and using images and other resources supplied by the Project, the Sheffield team transcribed eight manuscripts in full (Ad3, Corpus, Dd, Gg, Ellesmere, Ha4, Hengwrt, Lansdowne), sections of some seven other manuscripts, and all manuscripts of the Franklin's Tale. No part of these transcripts is contained in this iteration of the Project.

div.l: Þere was a pore ꝑperson of a toune
And was a goode man of religioune
Holy he was boþe in þouȝt ⁊ werk
Þerto he was alered man a clerk
Were hys ꝑperisshe housed neuer so fer a sonder
He lefte neiþer for reynes ne for þonder
Þe ferrest in hys ꝑperische to visite
He couþe haue suffisaūnce in þing ful lite
Ful loþe was hym to cursen for his tyþes
And so he was p yproued ofte syþes
Þus wolde he walke ⁊ in hys hand a staf
Þis noble ensample in to hys shepe he ȝaf
Þat fyrst he wrouȝt ⁊ afterward he tauȝt
Out of þe gospel he þo wordes rauȝt
He lete nauȝt hys benefice to hyr
And lete hys shepe emcōmbred in þe myr
Ne ran to londou Vnto seynt poules
To getyn hym a chauntery for soules
Oþer wiþ abreþerhede to be . wiþholde
But knelt at home ⁊ he kept hys owēm fold
So þat þe wolf ne made it nat myskary
He was a shepherde ⁊ nat amercenary
And þis figure he added eke þerto
Þat if gold rust what shal yren do
For ȝif a prest be foule on whom we trust
No wonder is a lewed man to rust
For it is a foule þing who so take kepe
A sheten shepherd ⁊ a clene shepe
He wayted aftr no pompe ne reuꝰerence
Ne made hym a spiced conscience
But cristis lore ⁊ hys apostles tweue
He tauȝt but first he folwed it hym selue .
